thread.title: U.K. Parliament in lockdown after reports of gunfire
thread.title_full: U.K. Parliament in lockdown after reports of gunfire

title: U.K. Parliament in lockdown after reports of gunfire
text:
Tweet 
The United Kingdom police are investigating a “firearms incident” outside the British Parliament in London after two people were shot . The alleged assailant has been shot, according to a government official. 
London’s Metropolitan Police said they received calls of an incident near Westminster Bridge around 2:40 p.m., according to a CNN report . 
At least a dozen people have been injured after large bangs were heard outside the parliament, a Reuters photographer said . 
“The alleged assailant was shot by police,” David Lidington, leader of the Commons, told the members of Parliament, adding that a police officer was stabbed and medical authorities are attending to those hurt by the incident, according to the Guardian . "He was very swiftly shot by armed police": A witness to the firearms incident near #Parliament #London pic.twitter.com/tyKFqAKCeB 
— Sky News (@SkyNews) March 22, 2017 
Sources have said Prime Minister Theresa May is safe. Government source says PM is OK 
— steve hawkes (@steve_hawkes) March 22, 2017 
The London Underground station of Westminster has been closed because of the incident, Transport for London said.
